body:
Shell Asset Management Co. boosted its position in Oracle Corp. (NYSE:ORCL) by 0.6% during the third quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 838,188 shares of the enterprise software provider’s stock after buying an additional 5,005 shares during the period. Oracle Corp. accounts for 0.8% of Shell Asset Management Co.’s holdings, making the stock its 22nd largest position. Shell Asset Management Co.’s holdings in Oracle Corp. were worth $32,924,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.

Several other hedge funds have also recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. Verity & Verity LLC boosted its position in Oracle Corp. by 1.6% in the third quarter. Verity & Verity LLC now owns 108,365 shares of the enterprise software provider’s stock valued at $4,257,000 after buying an additional 1,756 shares during the last quarter. Great West Life Assurance Co. Can boosted its position in Oracle Corp. by 0.7% in the third quarter. Great West Life Assurance Co. Can now owns 4,209,050 shares of the enterprise software provider’s stock valued at $165,162,000 after buying an additional 27,709 shares during the last quarter. Newman Dignan & Sheerar Inc. boosted its position in Oracle Corp. by 3.2% in the third quarter. Newman Dignan & Sheerar Inc. now owns 12,727 shares of the enterprise software provider’s stock valued at $500,000 after buying an additional 400 shares during the last quarter. Neville Rodie & Shaw Inc. boosted its position in Oracle Corp. by 167.9% in the third quarter. Neville Rodie & Shaw Inc. now owns 65,907 shares of the enterprise software provider’s stock valued at $2,589,000 after buying an additional 41,305 shares during the last quarter. Finally, GHP Investment Advisors Inc. boosted its position in Oracle Corp. by 1.4% in the third quarter. GHP Investment Advisors Inc. now owns 62,884 shares of the enterprise software provider’s stock valued at $2,470,000 after buying an additional 885 shares during the last quarter. 56.89% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.

Shares of Oracle Corp. (NYSE:ORCL) opened at 40.10 on Wednesday. The stock has a 50 day moving average of $39.35 and a 200 day moving average of $39.82. The firm has a market cap of $164.50 billion, a P/E ratio of 19.14 and a beta of 1.17. Oracle Corp. has a 52 week low of $34.47 and a 52 week high of $42.00.

Oracle Corp. (NYSE:ORCL) last released its quarterly earnings data on Thursday, December 15th. The enterprise software provider reported $0.61 EPS for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $0.60 by $0.01. Oracle Corp. had a return on equity of 21.33% and a net margin of 23.69%. The company earned $9.07 billion during the quarter. During the same period in the previous year, the company posted $0.63 EPS. The company’s quarterly revenue was up .5% compared to the same quarter last year. Analysts anticipate that Oracle Corp. will post $2.56 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.

The firm also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Thursday, January 26th. Shareholders of record on Thursday, January 5th will be issued a dividend of $0.15 per share. This represents a $0.60 annualized dividend and a yield of 1.50%. The ex-dividend date is Tuesday, January 3rd. Oracle Corp.’s dividend payout ratio is 28.99%.

Several equities analysts have commented on ORCL shares. DA Davidson set a $52.00 target price on shares of Oracle Corp. and gave the company a “buy” rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 11th. Cowen and Company reissued an “outperform” rating and set a $46.00 target price on shares of Oracle Corp. in a research note on Sunday, December 4th. Vetr raised shares of Oracle Corp. from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $42.92 price objective on the stock in a research note on Monday, November 28th. Rowe lowered their price objective on shares of Oracle Corp. from $109.00 to $9.30 in a research note on Tuesday, November 8th. Finally, RBC Capital Markets reaffirmed an “outperform” rating and issued a $43.00 price objective (up previously from $42.00) on shares of Oracle Corp. in a research note on Saturday, October 1st. Three research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, fifteen have given a hold rating and twenty-eight have given a buy rating to the company’s stock. The stock currently has an average rating of “Buy” and an average target price of $44.16.

In other Oracle Corp. news, Director Hector Garcia-Molina sold 3,750 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Thursday, December 15th. The stock was sold at an average price of $40.85, for a total transaction of $153,187.50. Following the completion of the sale, the director now owns 8,281 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $338,278.85. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available at the SEC website. Also, Director Naomi O. Seligman sold 45,000 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Wednesday, December 21st. The shares were sold at an average price of $38.72, for a total value of $1,742,400.00. Following the sale, the director now directly owns 52,654 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $2,038,762.88. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. Insiders have sold a total of 56,250 shares of company stock valued at $2,188,650 in the last ninety days. Insiders own 29.00% of the company’s stock.

Oracle Corporation (Oracle) provides products and services that address all aspects of corporate information technology (IT) environments, including application, platform and infrastructure. The Company’s businesses include cloud and on-premise software, hardware and services. Its cloud and on-premise software business consists of three segments, including cloud software and on-premise software, which includes Software as a Service (SaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) offerings, cloud infrastructure as a service (IaaS) and software license updates and product support.

title: Shell Asset Management Co. Has $32,924,000 Stake in Oracle Corp. (ORCL)
